main event: A fast-moving object was sighted by an aircraft approximately 5 miles off the left wing, moving parallel to the aircraft's heading of 107 degrees.
interesting points: The object appeared to be a 'big comet' and disappeared from view in less than 25 seconds.
The altitude of the object was estimated to be between 9,000 and 11,000 feet.
The speed of the object was in excess of 1,500 knots.
The object appeared to be in level flight, not climbing or descending.
The report mentions characteristics of a meteor, but indicates there was not enough information to determine if it was a meteor observation.
